quote: As you go through life you'll see There is so much that we Don't understand And the only thing we know Is things don't always go The way we planned
author: Simba

quote: ‘"Learned helplessness" is often learned help less-ness. If efforts to help are met with doubt, cynicism, finger pointing and skepticism...people offer to help less.’
author: John Cutler

quote: We're not here to just make it pretty easy to use. Through empathy. We ensure meaning and utility. With craft we elicit understanding and desire. We wrangle the complexity of our offering to deliver a clear, coherent and satisfying experience from start to finish.
author: Peter Merholz & Kristin Skinner

quote: O my brothers, break, break the old tablets!
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: Make sure—as quickly and as cheaply as you can—that you are building The Right It before you build It right.
author: Alberto Savoia

quote: There is nothing so useless as doing efficiently that which should not be done at all.
author: Jez Humble

quote: Design is really an act of communication, which means having a deep understanding of the person with whom the designer is communicating.
author: Donald A. Norman

quote: Product teams make decisions every day. Our goal with continuous discovery is to infuse those daily decisions with as much customer input as possible.
author: Teresa Torres

quote: What cannot be made simple cannot be made clear and what is not clear will not get done.
author: Stephen Bungay

quote: Users need to be able to find content before they can use it — findability precedes usability.
author: Louis Rosenfeld

quote: Our goal is not to create a deliverable, it’s to change something in the world — to create an outcome.
author: Jeff Gothelf

quote: When faced with two or more alternatives that deliver roughly the same value, take the path that makes future change easier.
author: Dave Thomas

quote: the modern world the power to persuade is the most important source of social power. But with such persuasiveness, you tend to convince yourself that you are correct, and you become less sensitive to others’ wishes, interests, and plights.
author: Simon Johnson

quote: the corporate world is littered with concept videos, detailed mockups, and other scenarios of possible futures. Their success is instead shown in how the vision catalyses action, inspiring the people within a company to charge forward because they want to live in a world where that vision is made a reality.
author: Peter Merholz

quote: If you want to build a ship, don’t drum up people to collect wood and don’t assign them tasks and work, but rather teach them to long for the endless immensity of the sea.
author: Kim Malone Scott

quote: The first truth is that at least half of our ideas are just not going to work. There are many reasons for an idea to not work out. The most common is that customers just aren't as excited about this idea as we are.
author: Marty Cagan

quote: So how does the… brain… get built from such a small recipe book? The answer… build incompletely and let world experience refine. Thus, for humans at birth, the brain is remarkably unfinished, and interaction with the world is necessary to complete it.
author: David Eagleman

quote: An abnormal reaction to an abnormal situation is normal behaviour.
author: Victor Frankl

quote: People employ products and services to get their job done, not to interact with your organization.
author: Jim Kalbach
source: The Jobs To Be Done Playbook
